benefits.description: Specially curated lineup of speakers and entertainment during the ceremony
Tickets for guests (guest ticket amounts may differ for each graduation)
Program booklet with your picture and 75 word acknowledgement

questions.question: What do I need to submit in order to participate in the Graduation Celebration?
answer: Submit the cultural graduation application and payment. Prices may vary
Submit your 75-word personal narrative to be on your booklet (Optional)
Schedule your photo to be taken (Optional. Your photo will be replaced with a default image.)

questions.question: How will my picture be taken for the booklet?
questions.answer: At the end of the Cultural Graduation Application, there will be an option to book an appointment to take your picture. Cap and gown will be provided

questions.question: What should I wear?
answer: For the photo in the booklet, dress semiformal, and a cap and gown will be provided at the designated photography location
For picture taking and the graduation celebration, a semi-formal attire is preferred. We encourage you to dress in your culture's traditional wear!

questions.question: How will I receive my sash
questions.answer: You will receive your sash the day of your respective cultural graduation inside the venue

questions.question: How many guest tickets do I get?
answer: ALL Graduations are open seating (not reserved). First come, first served
APIDA Grad # of Guest Tickets: TBD
Black Grad # of Guest Tickets: TBD
Nuestra Grad # of Guest Tickets: TBD
Pride Grad # of Guest Tickets: TBD

questions.question: I have more questions about applying. Who do I contact?
questions.answer: Please contact the respective center coordinator or the Cross Cultural Center (CCC) located on the 2nd floor of the University-Student Union. You may also email the CCC at ccc@calstatela.edu or call at 323-343-5001
